filesystem

Class DiskItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • filesystem.DiskItem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Directory, File

    public abstract class DiskItem
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class of disk items.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Tommy Messelis
    Invariants:
  • Each disk item must have a properly spelled name.
        isValidName(getName())
  • Each disk item must have a valid creation time.
        isValidCreationTime(getCreationTime())
  • Each disk item must have a valid modification time.
        canHaveAsModificationTime(getModificationTime())
  • Each disk item must have a valid parent directory.
        hasProperParentDirectory()

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Date creationTime
      Variable referencing the time of creation.
      private boolean isTerminated
      Variable registering whether or not this disk item has been terminated.
      private boolean isWritable
      Variable registering whether or not this disk item is writable.
      private java.util.Date modificationTime
      Variable referencing the time of the last modification, possibly null.
      private java.lang.String name
      Variable referencing the name of this disk item.
      private Directory parentDirectory
      Variable referencing the directory (if any) to which this disk item belongs.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiskItem

        @Model
 @Raw
protected DiskItem(java.lang.String name,
                                boolean writable)
        Initialize a new root disk item with given name and writability.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new disk item.
        writable - The writability of the new disk item.
        Postconditions:
      • The disk item is a root item
            new.isRoot()
      • The new creation time of this disk item is initialized to some time during constructor execution.
            (new.getCreationTime().getTime() >= System.currentTimeMillis()) &&
            (new.getCreationTime().getTime() <= (new System).currentTimeMillis())
      • The new disk item has no time of last modification.
            new.getModificationTime() == null
      • The new disk item is not terminated.
            !new.isTerminated()
        • Effects:
      • The name of the disk item is set to the given name. If the given name is not valid, a default name is set.
            setName(name)
      • The writability is set to the given flag
            setWritable(writable)

      • DiskItem

        @Model
 @Raw
protected DiskItem(Directory parent,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                boolean writable)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                DiskItemNotWritableException
        Initialize a new disk item with given parent directory, name and writability.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent directory of the new disk item.
        name - The name of the new disk item.
        writable - The writability of the new disk item.
        Postconditions:
      • The new creation time of this disk item is initialized to some time during constructor execution.
            (new.getCreationTime().getTime() >= System.currentTimeMillis()) &&
            (new.getCreationTime().getTime() <= (new System).currentTimeMillis())
      • The new disk item has no time of last modification.
            new.getModificationTime() == null
      • The new disk item is not terminated.
            !new.isTerminated()
        • Effects:
      • The name of the disk item is set to the given name. If the given name is not valid, a default name is set.
            setName(name)
      • The writability is set to the given flag
            setWritable(writable)
      • The given directory is set as the parent directory of this item.
            setParentDirectory(parent)
      • This item is added to the items of the parent directory
            parent.addAsItem(this)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given parent directory is not effective | parent == null
        DiskItemNotWritableException(parent) - The given parent directory is effective, but not writable. | parent != null && !parent.isWritable()
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given valid name already exists in the effective and writable parent directory | parent != null && parent.isWritable() && | isValidName(name) && parent.containsDiskItemWithName(name)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given name is not valid and the default name already exists in the effective parent directory | parent != null && parent.isWritable() && | !isValidName(name) && parent.containsDiskItemWithName(getDefaultName())
        DiskItemNotWritableException

    • Method Detail

      • isTerminated

        @Raw
 @Basic
public boolean isTerminated()
        Check whether this disk item is already terminated.

      • canBeTerminated

        public boolean canBeTerminated()
        Check whether this disk item can be terminated.
        Returns:
        True if the disk item is not yet terminated, is writable and it is either a root or its parent directory is writable
            if (isTerminated() || !isWritable() || (!isRoot() && !getParentDirectory().isWritable()))
            then result == false
        Note:
        This specification must be left open s.t. the subclasses can change it

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Terminate this disk item.
        Postconditions:
      • This disk item is terminated.
            new.isTerminated()
      • The disk item becomes a root item.
            new.isRoot();
        • Effect:
        If this disk item is not terminated and it is not a root, it is made a root
            if (!isTerminated() && !isRoot())
            then makeRoot()
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This disk item is not yet terminated and it can not be terminated. | !isTerminated() && !canBeTerminated()

      • getName

        @Raw
 @Basic
public java.lang.String getName()
        Return the name of this disk item.

      • isValidName

        public static boolean isValidName(java.lang.String name)
        Check whether the given name is a legal name for a disk item.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be checked
        Returns:
        True if the given string is effective, not empty and consisting only of letters, digits, dots, hyphens and underscores; false otherwise.
            result ==
             (name != null) && name.matches("[a-zA-Z_0-9.-]+")

      • setName

        @Raw
 @Model
private void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name of this disk item to the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name for disk item file.
        Postcondition:
        If the given name is valid, the name of this disk item is set to the given name, otherwise the name of the disk item is set to a valid name (the default).
            if (isValidName(name))
                 then new.getName().equals(name)
                 else new.getName().equals(getDefaultName())

      • getDefaultName

        @Model
private static java.lang.String getDefaultName()
        Return the name for a new disk item which is to be used when the given name is not valid.
        Returns:
        A valid file name.
            isValidName(result)

      • changeName

        public void changeName(java.lang.String name)
                throws DiskItemNotWritableException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Set the name of this disk item to the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name for this disk item.
        Effects:
      • The name of this disk item is set to the given name.
            setName(name)
      • The modification time is updated.
            setModificationTime()
      • If this disk item is not a root item, the order of the items in the parent directory is restored given the updated name of this item.
            if (!isRoot()) then
             getParentDirectory().restoreOrderAfterNameChangeAt(getParentDirectory().getIndexOf(this))
      • If this item is not a root item, then the modification time of the parent directory is updated.
            if (!isRoot()) then
             getParentDirectory().setModificationTime()
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This disk item is already terminated | isTerminated()
        DiskItemNotWritableException(this) - This disk item is not writable. | !isWritable()
        DiskItemNotWritableException(getParentDirectory()) - This disk item is not a root item and the parent directory is not writable. | !isRoot() && !getParentDirectory().isWritable()
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given name is valid, but this item is not a root item and its parent directory already contains an item with the given name. | !isRoot() && isValidName(name) && getParentDirectory().containsDiskItemWithName(name)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given name is not valid, and this item is not a root item and its parent directory already contains an item with the default name. | !isRoot() && !isValidName(name) && getParentDirectory().containsDiskItemWithName(getDefaultName())
        DiskItemNotWritableException

      • isOrderedAfter

        public boolean isOrderedAfter(java.lang.String name)
        Checks whether the name of this item is lexicographically ordered after the given name, ignoring case.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to compare with
        Returns:
        True if the given name is effective and the name of this item comes strictly after the given name (ignoring case), false otherwise.
            result == (name != null) && (getName().compareToIgnoreCase(name) > 0)

      • isOrderedBefore

        public boolean isOrderedBefore(java.lang.String name)
        Checks whether the name of this item is lexicographically ordered before the given name, ignoring case.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to compare with
        Returns:
        True if the given name is effective and the name of this item comes strictly before the given name (ignoring case), false otherwise.
            result == (name != null) && (getName().compareToIgnoreCase(name) < 0)

      • isOrderedAfter

        public boolean isOrderedAfter(@Raw
                              DiskItem other)
        Checks whether this item is ordered after the given other item according to the lexicographic ordering of their names, ignoring case.
        Parameters:
        other - The item to compare with
        Returns:
        True if the given other item is effective, and the name of this item is lexicographically ordered after the name of the given other item (ignoring case), false otherwise.
            result == (other != null) &&
                      isOrderedAfter(other.getName())

      • isOrderedBefore

        public boolean isOrderedBefore(@Raw
                               DiskItem other)
        Checks whether this item is ordered before the given other item according to the lexicographic ordering of their names, ignoring case.
        Parameters:
        other - The item to compare with
        Returns:
        True if the given other item is effective, and the name of this item is lexicographically ordered before the name of the given other item (ignoring case), false otherwise.
            result == (other != null) &&
                      isOrderedBefore(other.getName())

      • getCreationTime

        @Raw
 @Basic
 @Immutable
public java.util.Date getCreationTime()
        Return the time at which this disk item was created.

      • isValidCreationTime

        public static boolean isValidCreationTime(java.util.Date date)
        Check whether the given date is a valid creation time.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given date is effective and not in the future.
            result ==
             (date != null) &&
             (date.getTime() <= System.currentTimeMillis())

      • getModificationTime

        @Raw
 @Basic
public java.util.Date getModificationTime()
        Return the time at which this disk item was last modified, that is at which the name or content was last changed. If this disk item has not yet been modified after construction, null is returned.

      • canHaveAsModificationTime

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsModificationTime(java.util.Date date)
        Check whether this disk item can have the given date as modification time.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given date is either not effective or if the given date lies between the creation time and the current time.
            result == (date == null) ||
            ( (date.getTime() >= getCreationTime().getTime()) &&
              (date.getTime() <= System.currentTimeMillis())     )

      • setModificationTime

        @Model
 @Raw
protected void setModificationTime()
        Set the modification time of this disk item to the current time.
        Postconditions:
      • The new modification time is effective.
            new.getModificationTime() != null
      • The new modification time lies between the system time at the beginning of this method execution and the system time at the end of method execution.
            (new.getModificationTime().getTime() >=
                               System.currentTimeMillis()) &&
            (new.getModificationTime().getTime() <=
                               (new System).currentTimeMillis())

      • hasOverlappingUsePeriod

        public boolean hasOverlappingUsePeriod(DiskItem other)
        Return whether this disk item and the given other disk item have an overlapping use period.
        Parameters:
        other - The other disk item to compare with.
        Returns:
        False if the other disk item is not effective False if the prime object does not have a modification time False if the other disk item is effective, but does not have a modification time otherwise, true if and only if the open time intervals of this disk item and the other disk item overlap
            if (other == null) then result == false else
            if ((getModificationTime() == null)||
                  other.getModificationTime() == null)
               then result == false
               else
            result ==
            ! (getCreationTime().before(other.getCreationTime()) &&
              getModificationTime().before(other.getCreationTime()) ) &&
            ! (other.getCreationTime().before(getCreationTime()) &&
              other.getModificationTime().before(getCreationTime()) )

      • isWritable

        @Raw
 @Basic
public boolean isWritable()
        Check whether this disk item is writable.

      • setWritable

        @Raw
public void setWritable(boolean isWritable)
        Set the writability of this disk item to the given writability.
        Parameters:
        isWritable - The new writability
        Postcondition:
        The given writability is registered as the new writability for this disk item.
            new.isWritable() == isWritable

      • getRoot

        public DiskItem getRoot()
        Return the root item to which this item directly or indirectly belongs. In case this item is a root item, the item itself is the result.
        Returns:
        If this item is a root item, this item is returned; Otherwise the root to which the parent item of this item belongs is returned.
            if (isRoot())
            then result == this
            else result == getParentDirectory().getRoot()

      • makeRoot

        public void makeRoot()
              throws DiskItemNotWritableException
        Turns this disk item into a root disk item. (Nothing happens if this item is already a root item.)
        Effects:
      • If this disk item is not a root, this disk item is removed from its parent directory.
            if (!isRoot())
            then getParentDirectory().removeAsItem(this)
      • If this disk item is not a root, its modification time changed
            if (!isRoot())
            then setModificationTime()
      • The parent directory of this item is set to null.
            setParentDirectory(null)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This disk item is terminated | isTerminated()
        DiskItemNotWritableException(this) - This disk item is not a root and it is not writable | !isRoot() && !isWritable()
        DiskItemNotWritable(getParentDirectory()) - This disk item is not a root and its parent directory is not writable | !isRoot() && !getParentDirectory().isWritable()
        DiskItemNotWritableException

      • move

        public void move(Directory target)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 DiskItemNotWritableException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Move this disk item to a given directory.
        Parameters:
        target - The target directory.
        Effects:
      • If this disk item is not a root, this disk item is removed from its parent directory.
            if (!isRoot())
            then getParentDirectory().removeAsItem(this)
      • This disk item is added to the target directory.
            target.addAsItem(this)
      • The modification time is updated.
            setModificationTime()
      • The given directory is registered as the parent directory of this item.
            setParentDirectory(target)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This disk item is terminated | isTerminated()
        DiskItemNotWritableException(this) - This disk item is not writable | !isWritable()
        DiskItemNotWritable(getParentDirectory()) - This disk item is not a root and its parent directory is not writable | !isRoot() && !getParentDirectory().isWritable()
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given target directory is non-effective or is already registered as the parent directory. | (target == null) || (target == this.getParentDirectory())
        DiskItemNotWritableException(target) - This given target directory is effective but not writable | (target != null) && !target.isWritable()
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given directory is effective, but can not have this item as a member. | target != null && !target.canHaveAsItem(this)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The item cannot have the given target directory as a parent. (e.g. Moving the item to the given (effective) target directory would result in a cycle in the structure.) |target != null && !canHaveAsParentDirectory(target)
        DiskItemNotWritableException
        Note:
        Part of the job is to make this item a root item before adding it to the new parent directory. While we can use the implementation of that method, we can NOT use its specification in an effect clause! Doing so would include post condition that the item has null as a parent, which will not be the case here.

      • isRoot

        @Raw
public boolean isRoot()
        Check whether this item is a root item.
        Returns:
        True if this item has a non-effective parent directory; false otherwise.
            result == (getParentDirectory() == null)

      • hasProperParentDirectory

        @Raw
public boolean hasProperParentDirectory()
        Check whether this disk item has a proper parent directory as its parent directory.
        Returns:
        true if this disk item can have its registered parent directory as its parent directory and it is either a root, or its registered parent directory has this item as a registered item.
            result == canHaveAsParentDirectory(getParentDirectory()) &&
                       (isRoot() || getParentDirectory().hasAsItem(this))
        Note:
        This checker is split up in two parts, the consistency of the bidirectional relationship is added to the functionality of the internal state checker (canHaveAsParentDirectory())

      • canHaveAsParentDirectory

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsParentDirectory(Directory directory)
        Check whether this disk item can have the given directory as its parent directory.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to check.
        Returns:
        If this disk item is terminated, then true if the given directory is not effective, false otherwise.
            if (this.isTerminated()) then result == (directory == null)
        Returns:
        If the given directory is non-effective, then true
            if (directory == null) then result == true
        Returns:
        If the given directory is effective and terminated, then false
            if (directory != null && directory.isTerminated()) then result == false
        Notes:
      • The remaining checks are dependent on the type of disk item we are considering, so we include them at the level of the subclass. We must therefore leave the specification of this checker open at this level. (It does not specify an answer in all other cases, so no contradictions can occur when combined with the specification at the level of the subclasses.)
      • This checker considers only the content restrictions of the parent directory variable. It does not check the consistency of the bidirectional relationship. It can be used to check if the current parent directory is valid, or if a given directory can be accepted as a (new) parent directory.

      • isDirectOrIndirectChildOf

        public boolean isDirectOrIndirectChildOf(Directory directory)
        Checks whether this item is a direct or indirect child item of the given directory.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to check.
        Returns:
        If this is a root item, then false
            if this.isRoot() then result == false
        Returns:
        If the given directory is non-effective, then false
            if directory == null then result == false
        Returns:
        If this is not a root item and the given directory is effective, then true if this item is a direct or indirect child of the given directory, false otherwise
            if (!this.isRoot() && directory != null)
            then result == ( this.getParentDirectory() == directory ||
             this.getParentDirectory().isDirectOrIndirectChildOf(directory) )

      • setParentDirectory

        @Raw
 @Model
private void setParentDirectory(Directory directory)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                             java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Set the parent directory of this item to the given directory.
        Parameters:
        directory - The new parent directory for this item.
        Postcondition:
        The parent directory of this item is set to the given directory.
            new.getParentDirectory() == directory
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This item cannot have the given directory as its parent directory. | ! canHaveAsParentDirectory(parentDirectory)
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This disk item is terminated | isTerminated()
        Note:
        The setter is only responsible to satisfy the invariants of this class, not the bidirectionality of the relationship, nor the extra constraints associated with moving or deleting items.

      • getParentDirectory

        @Raw
 @Basic
public Directory getParentDirectory()
        Return the parent directory (if any) to which this item applies.
